problem_names:
lemma (in category) homI:
  assumes "f \<in> Ar" and "Dom f = A" and "Cod f = B"
  shows "f \<in> Hom A B"

lemma (in category) homE:
  assumes "A \<in> Ob" and "B \<in> Ob" and "f \<in> Hom A B"
  shows "Dom f = A" and "Cod f = B"

lemma (in category) id_arrow [intro]:
  assumes "A \<in> Ob"
  shows "Id A \<in> Ar"

lemma (in category) id_dom_cod:
  assumes "A \<in> Ob"
  shows "Dom (Id A) = A" and "Cod (Id A) = A"

lemma (in category) compI [intro]:
  assumes f: "f \<in> Ar" and g: "g \<in> Ar" and "Cod f = Dom g"
  shows "g \<bullet> f \<in> Ar"
  and "Dom (g \<bullet> f) = Dom f"
  and "Cod (g \<bullet> f) = Cod g"
translations:
lemma (in category) homI:
  assumes "f \<in> Ar" and "Dom f = A" and "Cod f = B"
  shows "f \<in> Hom A B"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. f \<in> Hom A B
using assms

proof (prove)
using this:
  f \<in> Ar
  Dom f = A
  Cod f = B

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. f \<in> Hom A B
by (auto simp add: hom_def)

lemma (in category) homE:
  assumes "A \<in> Ob" and "B \<in> Ob" and "f \<in> Hom A B"
  shows "Dom f = A" and "Cod f = B"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. Dom f = A &&& Cod f = B
proof-

proof (state)
goal (2 subgoals):
 1. Dom f = A
 2. Cod f = B
show "Dom f = A"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. Dom f = A
using assms

proof (prove)
using this:
  A \<in> Ob
  B \<in> Ob
  f \<in> Hom A B

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. Dom f = A
by (simp add: hom_def)

proof (state)
this:
  Dom f = A

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. Cod f = B
show "Cod f = B"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. Cod f = B
using assms

proof (prove)
using this:
  A \<in> Ob
  B \<in> Ob
  f \<in> Hom A B

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. Cod f = B
by (simp add: hom_def)

proof (state)
this:
  Cod f = B

goal:
No subgoals!
qed

lemma (in category) id_arrow [intro]:
  assumes "A \<in> Ob"
  shows "Id A \<in> Ar"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. Id A \<in> Ar
proof-

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. Id A \<in> Ar
from \<open>A \<in> Ob\<close>

proof (chain)
picking this:
  A \<in> Ob
have "Id A \<in> Hom A A"

proof (prove)
using this:
  A \<in> Ob

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. Id A \<in> Hom A A
by (rule id_hom)

proof (state)
this:
  Id A \<in> Hom A A

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. Id A \<in> Ar
thus "Id A \<in> Ar"

proof (prove)
using this:
  Id A \<in> Hom A A

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. Id A \<in> Ar
by (simp add: hom_def)

proof (state)
this:
  Id A \<in> Ar

goal:
No subgoals!
qed

lemma (in category) id_dom_cod:
  assumes "A \<in> Ob"
  shows "Dom (Id A) = A" and "Cod (Id A) = A"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. Dom (Id A) = A &&& Cod (Id A) = A
proof-

proof (state)
goal (2 subgoals):
 1. Dom (Id A) = A
 2. Cod (Id A) = A
from \<open>A \<in> Ob\<close>

proof (chain)
picking this:
  A \<in> Ob
have 1: "Id A \<in> Hom A A"

proof (prove)
using this:
  A \<in> Ob

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. Id A \<in> Hom A A

proof (state)
this:
  Id A \<in> Hom A A

goal (2 subgoals):
 1. Dom (Id A) = A
 2. Cod (Id A) = A
then

proof (chain)
picking this:
  Id A \<in> Hom A A
show "Dom (Id A) = A" and "Cod (Id A) = A"

proof (prove)
using this:
  Id A \<in> Hom A A

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. Dom (Id A) = A &&& Cod (Id A) = A
by (simp_all add: hom_def)

proof (state)
this:
  Dom (Id A) = A
  Cod (Id A) = A

goal:
No subgoals!
qed

lemma (in category) compI [intro]:
  assumes f: "f \<in> Ar" and g: "g \<in> Ar" and "Cod f = Dom g"
  shows "g \<bullet> f \<in> Ar"
  and "Dom (g \<bullet> f) = Dom f"
  and "Cod (g \<bullet> f) = Cod g"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. g \<bullet> f \<in> Ar &&&
    Dom (g \<bullet> f) = Dom f &&& Cod (g \<bullet> f) = Cod g
proof-

proof (state)
goal (3 subgoals):
 1. g \<bullet> f \<in> Ar
 2. Dom (g \<bullet> f) = Dom f
 3. Cod (g \<bullet> f) = Cod g
have "f \<in> Hom (Dom f) (Cod f)"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. f \<in> Hom (Dom f) (Cod f)
using f

proof (prove)
using this:
  f \<in> Ar

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. f \<in> Hom (Dom f) (Cod f)
by (simp add: hom_def)

proof (state)
this:
  f \<in> Hom (Dom f) (Cod f)

goal (3 subgoals):
 1. g \<bullet> f \<in> Ar
 2. Dom (g \<bullet> f) = Dom f
 3. Cod (g \<bullet> f) = Cod g
with \<open>Cod f = Dom g\<close>

proof (chain)
picking this:
  Cod f = Dom g
  f \<in> Hom (Dom f) (Cod f)
have f_homset: "f \<in> Hom (Dom f) (Dom g)"

proof (prove)
using this:
  Cod f = Dom g
  f \<in> Hom (Dom f) (Cod f)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. f \<in> Hom (Dom f) (Dom g)
by simp

proof (state)
this:
  f \<in> Hom (Dom f) (Dom g)

goal (3 subgoals):
 1. g \<bullet> f \<in> Ar
 2. Dom (g \<bullet> f) = Dom f
 3. Cod (g \<bullet> f) = Cod g
have g_homset: "g \<in> Hom (Dom g) (Cod g)"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. g \<in> Hom (Dom g) (Cod g)
using g

proof (prove)
using this:
  g \<in> Ar

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. g \<in> Hom (Dom g) (Cod g)
by (simp add: hom_def)

proof (state)
this:
  g \<in> Hom (Dom g) (Cod g)

goal (3 subgoals):
 1. g \<bullet> f \<in> Ar
 2. Dom (g \<bullet> f) = Dom f
 3. Cod (g \<bullet> f) = Cod g
have "(\<bullet>) : Hom (Dom g) (Cod g) \<rightarrow> Hom (Dom f) (Dom g) \<rightarrow> Hom (Dom f) (Cod g)"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<bullet>)
    \<in> Hom (Dom g) (Cod g) \<rightarrow>
          Hom (Dom f) (Dom g) \<rightarrow> Hom (Dom f) (Cod g)

proof (state)
this:
  (\<bullet>)
  \<in> Hom (Dom g) (Cod g) \<rightarrow>
        Hom (Dom f) (Dom g) \<rightarrow> Hom (Dom f) (Cod g)

goal (3 subgoals):
 1. g \<bullet> f \<in> Ar
 2. Dom (g \<bullet> f) = Dom f
 3. Cod (g \<bullet> f) = Cod g
from this and g_homset

proof (chain)
picking this:
  (\<bullet>)
  \<in> Hom (Dom g) (Cod g) \<rightarrow>
        Hom (Dom f) (Dom g) \<rightarrow> Hom (Dom f) (Cod g)
  g \<in> Hom (Dom g) (Cod g)
have "(\<bullet>) g \<in> Hom (Dom f) (Dom g) \<rightarrow> Hom (Dom f) (Cod g)"

proof (prove)
using this:
  (\<bullet>)
  \<in> Hom (Dom g) (Cod g) \<rightarrow>
        Hom (Dom f) (Dom g) \<rightarrow> Hom (Dom f) (Cod g)
  g \<in> Hom (Dom g) (Cod g)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<bullet>) g
    \<in> Hom (Dom f) (Dom g) \<rightarrow> Hom (Dom f) (Cod g)
by (rule funcset_mem)

proof (state)
this:
  (\<bullet>) g \<in> Hom (Dom f) (Dom g) \<rightarrow> Hom (Dom f) (Cod g)

goal (3 subgoals):
 1. g \<bullet> f \<in> Ar
 2. Dom (g \<bullet> f) = Dom f
 3. Cod (g \<bullet> f) = Cod g
from this and f_homset

proof (chain)
picking this:
  (\<bullet>) g \<in> Hom (Dom f) (Dom g) \<rightarrow> Hom (Dom f) (Cod g)
  f \<in> Hom (Dom f) (Dom g)
have gf_homset: "g \<bullet> f \<in> Hom (Dom f) (Cod g)"

proof (prove)
using this:
  (\<bullet>) g \<in> Hom (Dom f) (Dom g) \<rightarrow> Hom (Dom f) (Cod g)
  f \<in> Hom (Dom f) (Dom g)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. g \<bullet> f \<in> Hom (Dom f) (Cod g)
by (rule funcset_mem)

proof (state)
this:
  g \<bullet> f \<in> Hom (Dom f) (Cod g)

goal (3 subgoals):
 1. g \<bullet> f \<in> Ar
 2. Dom (g \<bullet> f) = Dom f
 3. Cod (g \<bullet> f) = Cod g
thus "g \<bullet> f \<in> Ar"

proof (prove)
using this:
  g \<bullet> f \<in> Hom (Dom f) (Cod g)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. g \<bullet> f \<in> Ar
by (simp add: hom_def)

proof (state)
this:
  g \<bullet> f \<in> Ar

goal (2 subgoals):
 1. Dom (g \<bullet> f) = Dom f
 2. Cod (g \<bullet> f) = Cod g
from gf_homset

proof (chain)
picking this:
  g \<bullet> f \<in> Hom (Dom f) (Cod g)
show "Dom (g \<bullet> f) = Dom f" and "Cod (g \<bullet> f) = Cod g"

proof (prove)
using this:
  g \<bullet> f \<in> Hom (Dom f) (Cod g)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. Dom (g \<bullet> f) = Dom f &&& Cod (g \<bullet> f) = Cod g
by (simp_all add: hom_def)

proof (state)
this:
  Dom (g \<bullet> f) = Dom f
  Cod (g \<bullet> f) = Cod g

goal:
No subgoals!
qed
end
